sourcesContent:
import Montag1 from "../images/Montag_Montag/Montag—Montag_01.png"
import Montag2 from "../images/Montag_Montag/Montag—Montag_02.png"
import Montag3 from "../images/Montag_Montag/Montag—Montag_03.png"
import Montag4 from "../images/Montag_Montag/Montag—Montag_04.png"
import Montag5 from "../images/Montag_Montag/Montag—Montag_05.png"

import Dimensions1 from "../images/Dimensions/Dimensions8.png"
import Dimensions2 from "../images/Dimensions/Dimensions7.png"
import Dimensions3 from "../images/Dimensions/Dimensions1.png"
import Dimensions4 from "../images/Dimensions/Dimensions3.png"
import Dimensions5 from "../images/Dimensions/Dimensions6.png"

import Kubernetes1 from "../images/Kubernetes/Kubernetes1.png"
import Kubernetes2 from "../images/Kubernetes/Kubernetes2.png"
import Kubernetes3 from "../images/Kubernetes/Kubernetes3.png"
import Kubernetes4 from "../images/Kubernetes/Kubernetes4.png"
import Kubernetes5 from "../images/Kubernetes/Kubernetes5.png"

import Diplom1 from "../images/Diplom/Diplom1.png"
import Diplom2 from "../images/Diplom/Diplom2.png"
import Diplom3 from "../images/Diplom/Diplom3.png"
import Diplom4 from "../images/Diplom/Diplom4.png"
import Diplom5 from "../images/Diplom/Diplom5.png"

import HtwsaarWeb1 from "../images/htwsaarweb/HtwsaarWeb1.png"
import HtwsaarWeb2 from "../images/htwsaarweb/HtwsaarWeb2.png"
import HtwsaarWeb3 from "../images/htwsaarweb/HtwsaarWeb3.png"
import HtwsaarWeb4 from "../images/htwsaarweb/HtwsaarWeb4.png"
import HtwsaarWeb5 from "../images/htwsaarweb/HtwsaarWeb5.png"

import Nowhere1 from "../images/Nowhere/Nowhere1.gif"
import Nowhere2 from "../images/Nowhere/Nowhere2.png"
import Nowhere3 from "../images/Nowhere/Nowhere3.png"
import Nowhere4 from "../images/Nowhere/Nowhere4.png"
import Nowhere5 from "../images/Nowhere/Nowhere5.png"

import worklove1 from "../images/worklove/worklove1.png"
import worklove2 from "../images/worklove/worklove2.png"
import worklove3 from "../images/worklove/worklove3.png"
import worklove4 from "../images/worklove/worklove4.png"
import worklove5 from "../images/worklove/worklove5.png"
import worklove6 from "../images/worklove/worklove6.png"
import worklove7 from "../images/worklove/worklove7.png"
import worklove8 from "../images/worklove/worklove8.png"
import worklove9 from "../images/worklove/worklove9.png"

const projects = [
  {
    theme: "bread",
    bg: "#130972",
    fg: "#f78765",
    title: "Montag — Montag",
    specs:
      "The catalogue for the exhibition »Montag—Montag« by the Amsterdam based artist Lucie Sahner brings together a poetic and a pseudo-scientific approach. From a typographic/design point of view the catalogue is constantly changing between the clean aesthetic of an encylopedia and a playfully poetic visual level.",
    url: "https://kuenstlerhaus-saar.de/ausschreibungen/atelierstipendium/lucie-sahner-2017/",
    date: "2018",
    client: "Künstlerhaus Saarbrücken",
    product: "Art Catalog",
    services: "Editorial Design",
    usedTechnologies: "",
    latest: true,
    image: Montag1,
    specImage1: Montag2,
    specImage2: Montag3,
    specImage3: Montag4,
    specImage4: Montag5,
    category: ["analog", "all"],
  },
  {
    theme: "bread",
    bg: "#130972",
    fg: "#f78765",
    title: "Dimensions",
    specs:
      "In close cooperation with the technical directors of Dimension, a web application for the research community, where you can search across multiple content types, ranging from publications to grants, clinical trials, patents, datasets and policy documents, the dependencies between different teams, the data flow, and the data management were visually analyzed in this project. It was a great pleasure to gradually understand how data is refined in different enrichment steps, which databases are involved, which processes run simultaneously, which are interdependent. Loved it.",
    url: "https://www.dimensions.ai/",
    date: "2018",
    client: "Digital Science",
    product: "Software Architecture Visualization",
    services: "Visualization, Presentation Slides",
    usedTechnologies: "",
    latest: true,
    image: Dimensions2,
    specImage1: Dimensions1,
    specImage2: Dimensions3,
    specImage3: Dimensions4,
    specImage4: Dimensions5,
    category: ["digital", "all"],
  },

  {
    theme: "butter",
    fg: "#130972",
    bg: "#f78765",
    title: "1+1=5",
    specs:
      "My diploma final project ... and a very personal one. In collaboration with my sister we dealt with our family history.  We were raised in a shared apartment with our two mothers and my brother. To find out how this family constellation affected our development and character, we interviewed all the people involved and compiled a historical summary. The exhibition is intended to show the different stations of the common life of our mothers and finally described why and how one and one became five.",
    url: "",
    date: "2014",
    client: "self-initiated project",
    product: "Book & Exhibition",
    services: "",
    usedTechnologies: "",
    latest: true,
    image: Diplom4,
    specImage1: Diplom3,
    specImage2: Diplom1,
    specImage3: Diplom2,
    specImage4: Diplom5,
    category: ["analog", "all"],
  },

  {
    theme: "bread",
    bg: "#130972",
    fg: "#f78765",
    title: "Kubernetes",
    specs:
      "Together with the Head of Software Development at UberResearch GmbH / Digital Science a presentation was developed to show the advantages of Kubernetes for the stability and performance of the webapp Dimensions.",
    url: "https://www.dimensions.ai/",
    date: "2018",
    client: "Digital Science",
    product: "Software Architecture Visualization",
    services: "Visualization, Presentation Slides",
    usedTechnologies: "",
    latest: true,
    image: Kubernetes1,
    specImage1: Kubernetes2,
    specImage2: Kubernetes3,
    specImage3: Kubernetes4,
    specImage4: Kubernetes5,
    category: ["digital", "all"],
  },

  {
    theme: "bread",
    bg: "#130972",
    fg: "#f78765",
    title: "htw saar",
    specs:
      "Together with the Head of Software Development at UberResearch GmbH / Digital Science a presentation was developed to show the advantages of Kubernetes for the stability and performance of the webapp Dimensions.",
    url: "https://www.htwsaar.de/",
    date: "2020",
    client: "University of Applied science Saar",
    product: "Website",
    services: "UX / UI, Conceptualization",
    usedTechnologies: "Figma",
    latest: true,
    image: HtwsaarWeb1,
    specImage1: HtwsaarWeb2,
    specImage2: HtwsaarWeb3,
    specImage3: HtwsaarWeb4,
    specImage4: HtwsaarWeb5,
    category: ["digital", "all"],
  },
  {
    theme: "butter",
    fg: "#130972",
    bg: "#f78765",
    title: "I am nowhere",
    specs:
      "I am nowhere, I am now here. ",
    url: "https://stadtgalerie-saarbruecken.de/",
    date: "2018",
    client: "Stadtaglerie Saarbrücken",
    product: "Exhibition",
    services: "",
    usedTechnologies: "",
    latest: true,
    image: Nowhere1,
    specImage1: Nowhere2,
    specImage2: Nowhere3,
    specImage3: Nowhere4,
    specImage4: Nowhere5,
    category: ["digital", "all"],
  },
  {
    theme: "butter",
    fg: "#130972",
    bg: "#f78765",
    title: "worklove",
    specs:
      "In the last few years Joni and I have been exploring the question of how to work and live without getting fucked up. Every Tuesday we met in the bar and talked, documented and got drunk. Over the years, a remarkable collection of questions has been created. At the same time we started to pour our feelings about each of the 96 questions into a handmade poster. In cooperation with the Hermann Schmidt Verlag we are now working on the book »worklove«, which will be published in 2021.",
    url: "",
    date: "2021",
    client: "Published at Hermann Schmidt Verlag",
    product: "Book and 96 Posters",
    latest: true,
    image: worklove1,
    specImage1: worklove2,
    specImage2: worklove3,
    specImage3: worklove4,
    specImage4: worklove5, 
    specImage5: worklove6,
    specImage6: worklove7,
    specImage7: worklove8,
    specImage8: worklove9,
    category: ["analog", "all"],
  },


 
];

export default projects;
